Html:
Hello,

is there a reason why the current assemblies are not signed any more (having no stong name)?

Is this planned again for the future?

the netoffice assemblies are signed. i made a mistake? which release and .net version u use?
Sebastian

I downloaded 89488.

When building the source: the "sign the assembly" -flag in project properties are disabled, over all projects.

Thanks a lot.

hello,

the source code doesnt contains signed solutions. one of the ideas of signing is trusted publishing as far i known. the assembly signing makes sure the assembly is from NetOffice himself. in other words: all release assemblies are signed but never the source. i dont publish the key files here. you can create your own fork and sign of course. if you want a custom version with the original keyfiles please send me your source code. I take look, already was okay and sign your solution(NetOffice is Free Software and dont do evil at all) Why you need a ciustom version of NetOffice. You want to shrink the assemblies?  If you have suggestions then i can integrate your ideas in NetOffice.

Sebastian
